channel.title: Run cmd for all users

item.title: Run cmd for all users
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“ultimatepkvillage, post:6, topic:463055”]Why can’t they change it to their version of java? not that hard

@echo off title Run "C:\Program Files\Java\VERSION OF JAVA\bin\ava" -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 exit[/quote]
The average PC/Mac user doesn’t know their own Java version, as they just update it with the little pop-up. They expect everything just to work, because usually these big game companies just take counter-measures for any issues people may undergo.

Read full topic

item.title: Run cmd for all users
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

Instead of redirecting it to the execution file you can also just use the “java” command since most OS reckognize Java.

If you’re using this for a compiler (which your users shouldn’t even have acces to in the first place) then there’s nothing you can do since this is basic knowledge and they’ll have to figure it out themselves.

Read full topic

item.title: Run cmd for all users
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Why can’t they change it to their version of java? not that hard

@echo off title Run "C:\Program Files\Java\VERSION OF JAVA\bin\ava" -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 exit

Read full topic

item.title: Run cmd for all users
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:4, topic:463055”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=566345.msg4118523#msg4118523 date=1349390393]
Have them set their environment variables, then just use tyb’s code.
[/quote]
They don’t even have to do that, java should already be recognized by most Windows systems… You could also always just jar it.[/quote]

Perhaps with the release of Java 7 it adds the path automatically.

Read full topic

item.title: Run cmd for all users
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

zyle1992:

Have them set their environment variables, then just use tyb’s code.

They don’t even have to do that, java should already be recognized by most Windows systems… You could also always just jar it.

Read full topic

item.title: Run cmd for all users
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Have them set their environment variables, then just use tyb’s code.

Read full topic

item.title: Run cmd for all users
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\bin/java”
“\bin/”

But, just change it to:

[quote=“Gravity pk, post:1, topic:463055”]@echo off
title Run
java -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32
exit[/quote]
As long as their Java is updated, they are good to go.

Read full topic

item.title: Run cmd for all users
item.dc:creator: @Gravity_pk Gravity pk
item.description:
@Gravity_pk wrote:

title says all, i need a run cmd that will work for all users. my current one is set to run from my jdk version, heres my current one.

@echo off
title Run
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\bin/java” -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32
exit

this isn’t good because im prettysure 99% of players wont have my jdk version, or even jdk in general so i need one user friendly. anyone know how i can do this i looked a lot of places but none of them worked

Read full topic
